# Data.

## Codebook.

Below here you find a codebook explaining each variable.

```{r}
codebook <- read.delim("codebook.txt", sep = ";")
knitr::kable(codebook)
```

## Reading the data.

Here we load in the data. I noticed when downloading not all genders had the same case so I made all genders upper-case.

```{r}
my_data <- read.csv("data/Smoker_Epigenetic_df.csv")
str(my_data)
my_data$Gender <- toupper(my_data$Gender)
summary(my_data)

```

# Visualisation.

```{r}
ggplot(data = my_data, aes(Age, cg00050873, colour = factor(Gender), shape = factor(Smoking.Status))) +
  geom_point()

```

# research.

## research question.

Is it possible to predict the Methylation of certain CpG islands, with patient data like age, gender and smoker status, using Machine Learning?
